kin: Al Mustapaha Razrazi, inzobere mu by'imitekerereze ya muntu akaba n'umwe mu bagize komite ishinzwe ubumenyi muri iyo gahunda, yavuze ko mu bantu 156 barekuwe nyuma yo kwitabira amasomo, umwe gusa yongeye gufatwa akora icyaha.
mt0: <pad> Al Mustapaha Razrazi, a clinical psychologist and member of the program's scientific committee, said among 156 people who have been released after attending the courses, just one has been caught committing a crime again.</s>

en: That person was convicted of a non-terrorism-related offense, he said.
kin: Yavuze ko uwo muntu yahamijwe n'icyaha kijyanye n'iterabwoba.
mt0: <pad> Ayo muntu yaciriwe urubanza ku byaha bifitanye isano n'iterabwoba, nk'uko yavuze.</s>

en: Iran Gets Opportunity to Sell Auto Parts to Russian Carmaker
kin: Irani ibonye amahirwe yo kugurisha ibice by'imodoka ku Barusiya bakora imodoka.
mt0: <pad> Iran igiye kugurisha ibikoresho by'imodoka mu Burusiya</s>

en: A member of Iran's syndicate of car parts manufacturers says Iranian producers have an opportunity to export their wares to a Russian carmaker, state media reported.
kin: Ibitangazamakuru bya Leta byatangaje ko umunyamuryango wa syndicat ya Irani y’ibicuruzwa by’imodoka avuga ko abakora muri Irani bafite amahirwe yo kohereza ibicuruzwa byabo mu ruganda rukora imodoka mu Burusiya.
mt0: <pad> Agize uruhare mu gukora ibikoresho by'imodoka muri Iran avuga ko abakora ibikoresho by'imodoka bafite amahirwe yo kugurisha ibikoresho byabo ku nzu y'imodoka yo muri Russia, ibiro ntaramakuru by'ubutegetsi bivuga.</s>

en: The late Monday report quoted Hossein Bahrainian as saying "a prominent Russian car maker" requested parts from Iran. He did not name the manufacturer. He said it requested brake parts, airbags, air-conditioner parts and other components.
kin: Raporo yo ku wa mbere yarangiye ivuga ko Hossein Bahrein yavuze ko "uruganda rukomeye rw’imodoka yo mu Burusiya" rwasabye ibice muri Irani. Ntiyavuze uwabikoze. Yavuze ko isaba ibice bya feri, ibikapu byo mu kirere, ibyuma bifata ibyuma bikonjesha n'ibindi bikoresho.
mt0: <pad> Amakuru yamenyekanye ku wa kabiri yavuzeko "umucuruzi w'imodoka ukomeye w'u Burusiya" yasabye ibikoresho by'amapine i Iran. Ntiyigeze avuga izina ry'uwo mucuruzi. Yagize ati: "Yasabaga ibikoresho by'amapine, imiduga y'abagenzi, ibikoresho by'ibikoresho by'inyegamo n'ibindi bikoresho."</s>

en: Both Iran and Russia are under U.S. sanctions but the export of Iranian cars and car parts is not subject to sanctions.
kin: Irani n'Uburusiya byombi bihanishwa Amerika ariko kohereza imodoka za Irani n'ibice by'imodoka ntabwo bihanwa.
mt0: <pad> Iran na Russia ziri mu mabwiriza ya Amerika, ariko ibikorwa by'ubucuruzi bw'imodoka n'ibikoresho byayo ntibyashyizwe mu mabwiriza.</s>

en: The import of automobiles to Iran is also not subject to sanctions. However, Tehran has not imported cars since 2018, after the U.S. withdrew from a nuclear deal between Iran and world powers and imposed oil and banking sanctions on Iran.
kin: Gutumiza imodoka muri Irani nabyo ntabwo bihanwa. Icyakora, Tehran ntabwo yatumije imodoka kuva mu 2018, nyuma y’uko Amerika ivuye mu masezerano ya kirimbuzi hagati ya Irani n’ibihugu by’isi ndetse ikanafatira Irani ibihano bya peteroli na banki.
mt0: <pad> Importing cars into Iran is not subject to sanctions. However, Tehran has not imported cars since 2018, after the U.S. withdrew from a nuclear deal between Iran and world powers and imposed oil and banking sanctions on Iran.</s>

en: Western nations stopped exporting to Russia after the invasion of Ukraine.
kin: Ibihugu by’iburengerazuba byahagaritse kohereza mu Burusiya nyuma yo gutera Ukraine.
mt0: <pad> Nyinshi mu bihugu by'i Burayi byahagaritse gutanga ibicuruzwa muri rusange nyuma y'uko Ukraine yafashwe.</s>

en: Iran in recent years has exported car radiators and suspension systems to Russia. In the past it exported cars to Iraq, Syria and Venezuela.
kin: Irani mu myaka yashize yohereje mu Burusiya imirasire y’imodoka na sisitemu zo guhagarika. Kera yoherezaga imodoka muri Iraki, Siriya na Venezuwela.
mt0: <pad> Iran mu myaka ishize yasohoye radiyo za gariyamoshi na sisiteme zo gukubita ibikoresho by'imodoka muri Russia. Mu gihe cyashize yasohoye imodoka muri Iraki, Siriya na Venezuela.</s>

en: Tehran and Moscow have had close relations in recent years, especially after Iran's sole nuclear power plant went online in 2011 with help from Russia.
kin: Tehran na Moscou bafitanye umubano wa hafi mu myaka yashize, cyane cyane nyuma y’uko uruganda rukora ingufu za kirimbuzi rukumbi rwa Irani rujya kuri interineti mu 2011 babifashijwemo n’Uburusiya.
mt0: <pad> Tehran na Moscow bagiye bafitanye umubano mwiza mu myaka yashize, cyane cyane nyuma y'uko ikigo kimwe cya Iran gikora uburiro bwa nyuki cyayo cyageze kuri internet muri 2011 ku bufasha bw'uburusiya.</s>

en: Separately on Tuesday, Iran said it has played a mediatory role in the war in Ukraine.
kin: Ku wa kabiri, Irani yavuze ko yagize uruhare mu bunzi mu ntambara yo muri Ukraine.
mt0: <pad> Iran ivuga ko yagize uruhare mu gukemura intambara muri Ukraine.</s>

en: "So far twice I have conveyed messages from the foreign minister of Ukraine to my Russian counterpart," said Foreign Minister Hossein Amir Abdollahian in a phone conversation with his Irish counterpart. He said Iran supports diplomatic solutions for restoring peace and stability.
kin: Minisitiri w’ububanyi n’amahanga Hossein Amir Abdollahian mu kiganiro kuri telefoni na mugenzi we wa Irlande yagize ati: "Kugeza ubu inshuro ebyiri zose nagejeje ubutumwa kuri minisitiri w’ububanyi n’amahanga wa Ukraine kuri mugenzi wanjye w’Uburusiya." Yavuze ko Irani ishyigikiye ibisubizo by’ububanyi n’amahanga mu kugarura amahoro n’amahoro.
mt0: <pad> "Ntabwo nshobora kuvuga ko nshaka kuvuga ko ubwa kabiri nashyize imbere ibitekerezo by'umunyamabanga w'ububanyi n'amahanga wa Ukraine ku munyamabanga w'ububanyi n'amahanga wa Russia," he said.</s>

en: Abdollahian did not elaborate but said Iran "opposes war and displacement of human beings in Ukraine," and other paces like Yemen, the Palestinian lands and Afghanistan.
kin: Abdollahian ntabwo yabisobanuye ariko yavuze ko Irani "irwanya intambara no kwimura abantu muri Ukraine," ndetse n'indi ntera nka Yemeni, ibihugu bya Palesitine na Afuganisitani.
mt0: <pad> Abdollahian ntiyavuze byinshi, ahubwo yavuze ko Iran "ivuga nabi intambara no kwirukanwa kw'abantu muri Ukraine," nk'uko Yemen, Palestine, na Afghanistan.</s>

en: Diversity, New Perspectives Are Applied to Middle East Coverage
kin: Dutandukanye, Ibitekerezo bishya bikoreshwa muburasirazuba bwo hagati
mt0: <pad> Diversity, New Perspectives Are Applied to Middle East Coverage</s>

en: Natalia Sancha has always adopted a collaborative approach to journalism. When out on assignment, she speaks to others covering the same story about their perspectives.
kin: Nataliya Sancha yamye afata inzira yo gufatanya mubanyamakuru. Iyo asohotse mukoro, avugana nabandi bavuga inkuru imwe kubitekerezo byabo.
mt0: <pad> Natalia Sancha yagiye agira uburyo bushya bwo gukora ubushakashatsi. Iyo ari mu rugendo, ajya kuvugana n'abandi bavuga kuri iryo jambo kugira ngo amenye ibitekerezo byabo.</s>

en: This partly stems from an interest in telling underreported stories, but as a female journalist in a male-dominated region, she says collaboration and supporting the women she works with have always been important.
kin: Ibi bimwe bituruka ku gushimishwa no kuvuga inkuru zidasobanutse, ariko nkumunyamakuru wumugore mukarere kariganjemo abagabo, avuga ko ubufatanye no gutera inkunga abagore bakorana byahoze ari ngombwa.
mt0: <pad> Bye bye Rwanda, bye bye Rwanda</s>

en: "I would talk to male and female journalists, and I always realized that women had a similar perspective, because we had similar experiences while covering the story," the 42-year-old journalist said.
kin: Umunyamakuru w'imyaka 42 yagize ati: "Naganiriye n'abanyamakuru b'abagabo n'abagore, kandi buri gihe nabonaga ko abagore bafite imyumvire imwe, kuko natwe twagize ibyabaye mugihe twatangaga inkuru".
mt0: <pad> "Nagendaga nvugana n'abanyamakuru b'igitsina gabo n'abagore, kandi igihe cyose najyaga nibaza ko abagore bafite ibitekerezo bitandukanye, kubera ko twagize ibitekerezo bitandukanye ubwo twakurikiranaga iki kibazo," uwo munyamakuru w'imyaka 42 yagize ati.</s>

en: That collaborative approach came into play in 2020 when a publisher asked Sancha if she was interested in writing a book about Syria.
kin: Ubwo buryo bwo gufatanya bwatangiye gukurikizwa mu 2020 ubwo umubwiriza yabazaga Sancha niba ashishikajwe no kwandika igitabo kivuga kuri Siriya.
mt0: <pad> Ese buryo bufatanyije bwatanguye muri 2020 ubwo umwanditsi yabazaga Sancha niba yari yishimiye gukora igitabo kuri Siriya.</s>

en: She countered with a better offer.
kin: Yarwanyije icyifuzo cyiza.
mt0: <pad> She countered with a better offer.</s>

en: "I told him that a collective narrative by women journalists about the broader region would have a different effect," she said. "I could have written the book myself, but it would not have the same sense."
kin: Ati: "Namubwiye ko inkuru rusange y'abanyamakuru b'abagore ivuga ku karere kanini byagira ingaruka zitandukanye." "Nanjye ubwanjye nashoboraga kwandika igitabo, ariko ntabwo cyari kumva kimwe."
mt0: <pad> "Ndamubwiye ko igitekerezo cyacu cyaba kigomba guhindura ishusho y'umujyi wacu," yagize ati: "Ishoboraga kuba nanditse igitabo njye ubwanjye, ariko ntabwo byagira intego nk'iyo."</s>

en: Originally from Andalusia in southern Spain, Sancha spent the past 14 years in the Middle East covering conflicts in Iraq, Syria and Yemen, and reporting from Egypt, Lebanon and Tunisia.
kin: Sancha ukomoka muri Andalusiya mu majyepfo ya Espagne, Sancha yamaze imyaka 14 ishize mu burasirazuba bwo hagati yerekana amakimbirane yo muri Iraki, Siriya na Yemeni, kandi atanga raporo avuye muri Egiputa, Libani na Tuniziya.
mt0: <pad> Bye bye Middle East.</s>

en: She has been working more recently with the European Union communications department, after leaving Beirut for health reasons following a mass explosion that rocked the city in 2020.
kin: Aherutse gukorana n’ishami ry’itumanaho ry’umuryango w’ubumwe bw’ibihugu by’Uburayi, nyuma yo kuva i Beirut kubera impamvu z’ubuzima nyuma y’igiturika kinini cyibasiye umujyi muri 2020.
mt0: <pad> She has been working more recently with the European Union communications department, after leaving Beirut for health reasons following the mass explosion that rocked the city in 2020</s>

en: Women "have a different experience because we would go to places that our male colleagues were not used to. Not because we're smarter, but just because the majority of the region is still Arab, Muslim and gender-segregated," Sancha told VOA.
kin: Sancha yabwiye VOA ati: "Abagore" bafite uburambe butandukanye kuko twajya ahantu bagenzi bacu b'igitsina gabo batamenyereye. Ntabwo ari ukubera ko turi abanyabwenge, ahubwo ni ukubera ko igice kinini cy'akarere kikiri abarabu, abayisilamu ndetse n'abagabo."
mt0: <pad> Akazi k'igitsina gore "kaba gatandukanye kubera ko twagiye ahantu abakozi bafana batamenyereye. Si kubera ko turi abantu bwenge, ahubwo kubera ko igice kinini cy'iki gihugu ari Arab, Muslim n'imico ya kigore n'igitsina-segregated," Sancha told VOA.</s>

en: Having women reporters has an impact, she noted.
kin: Yavuze ko kugira abanyamakuru b'abagore bigira ingaruka.
mt0: <pad> Gufite abavuga rumwe b'igitsina gore bifite umusaruro, yashimye.</s>

en: "If I put myself in the position of the reader, I would prefer to have a woman telling me the story because it is going to be about 100 percent of the population, which means you are going to have a more inclusive narrative on the conflict."
kin: "Niba nishyize mu mwanya w'abasomyi, nahitamo kugira umugore umbwira inkuru kuko igiye kuba hafi 100 ku ijana by'abaturage, bivuze ko uzaba ufite inkuru zuzuye zirimo amakimbirane."
mt0: <pad> "Niba nshyira ubwanjye mu mwanya w'umusomi, nahitamo ko umukobwa yavugaga inkuru kuko ari we uzaba ufite hafi 100 % y'abaturage, bivuze ko uzabona igitekerezo gifite uruhare runini ku ntambara."</s>

en: For her book, Sancha reached out to other women who cover the Middle East, to ensure diverse perspectives from foreign and local reporters.
kin: Ku gitabo cye, Sancha yageze ku bandi bagore bavuga iburasirazuba bwo hagati, kugira ngo babone ibitekerezo bitandukanye n'abanyamakuru bo mu mahanga ndetse n'abenegihugu.
mt0: <pad> Bye bye Middle East.</s>

en: The result of the nearly two-year collaboration is Bullets for All, released in Spanish in April.
kin: Ibisubizo byubufatanye bwimyaka hafi ibiri ni Bullets kuri Bose, yasohotse mu cyesipanyoli muri Mata.
mt0: <pad> Umusaruro w'imikorere ya hafi imyaka ibiri ni Bullets for All, yasohotse muri Mata mu Cpanyolo.</s>

en: In the book, "we tell one story with different voices that represent all the women" from the region, Sancha said.
kin: Muri iki gitabo, Sancha yagize ati: "Muri iki gitabo," tuvuga inkuru imwe n'amajwi atandukanye ahagarariye abagore bose ".
mt0: <pad> Mu gitabo, "turavuze inkuru imwe mu ndimi zitandukanye zivuze abagore bose" bo muri ako karere, Sancha said.</s>

en: Each offers a personal perspective on covering historic moments, including the collapse of autocratic governments, popular protest movements and war. It also examines the discrimination and harassment women face in the newsroom and on assignment.
kin: Buri kimwe gitanga icyerekezo cyihariye cyo kwerekana ibihe byamateka, harimo gusenyuka kwa guverinoma yigenga, imyigaragambyo yamamaye nintambara. Irasuzuma kandi ivangura n'ihohoterwa abagore bahura nabyo mu cyumba cy'amakuru no ku mukoro.
mt0: <pad> Buri atanga amakuru ku bihe by'amateka, harimo gukuraho kwa leta za autocrate, imyigaragambyo y'abaturage n'intambara. Irebana kandi n'ihohoterwa n'ubusambanyi abagore bahura nabwo mu nyubakwa y'ikinyamakuru no mu gihugu.</s>

en: Making connections
kin: Gukora amasano
mt0: <pad> Making a cake by making a cake</s>

en: Understanding language and culture goes a long way toward making progress in the region, says Maya Gebeily. The Reuters bureau chief for Lebanon, Syria and Jordan is one of the contributors to the book.
kin: Maya Gebeily avuga ko gusobanukirwa ururimi n'umuco bigana inzira igana ku iterambere. Umuyobozi w'ikigo cya Reuters muri Libani, Siriya na Yorodani ni umwe mu bagize uruhare muri iki gitabo.
mt0: <pad> Kumenya ururimi n'umuco byafasha cyane mu gukora iterambere mu gihugu, nk'uko Maya Gebeily abivuga.</s>

en: "There's a lot to say and show from the perspective of women reporters who were also then influenced by the women that they met as they were doing their reporting," she said.
kin: Ati: "Hariho byinshi byo kuvuga no kwerekana nkurikije uko abanyamakuru b'abagore na bo bahise bayoborwa n'abagore bahuye igihe bakoraga raporo zabo".
mt0: <pad> "Hariho byinshi byo kuvuga no kwerekana ukubona ishusho y'abagore bamenyeshamakuru bamaze guhura n'abagore bagiye bakora ubushakashatsi," yagize ati "hariho byinshi byo kuvuga no kwerekana ukubona ishusho y'abagore bamenyeshamakuru bamaze guhura n'abagore bagiye bakora ubushakashatsi."</s>

en: Born in the U.S. to Lebanese parents, Gebeily started her journalism career in 2013 with a local news site in Beirut, Lebanon. She went on to cover the region for Agence France-Presse before joining Reuters.
kin: Gebeily yavukiye muri Amerika ku babyeyi bo muri Libani, yatangiye umwuga we w'itangazamakuru mu 2013 akoresheje urubuga rw'amakuru i Beirut, muri Libani. Yakomeje yerekeza mu karere ka Agence France-Presse mbere yo kwinjira muri Reuters.
mt0: <pad> Baby Gebeily was born in the U.S. to Lebanese parents, Gebeily started her journalism career in 2013 with a local news site in Beirut, Lebanon. She went on to cover the region for Agence France-Presse before joining Reuters.</s>

en: Gebeily said her American and Lebanese background helped her understand the region better, which in turn has shaped her reporting. Knowing the local language is an important part of that.
kin: Gebeily yavuze ko amateka ye y'Abanyamerika na Libani yamufashije kumva neza akarere, ari nako kagize uruhare mu gutanga raporo. Kumenya ururimi rwaho nigice cyingenzi cyibyo.
mt0: <pad> Gebeily yavuze ko ubwoko bw'Amerika na Lebanese bwafashije gukora ubushakashatsi bwiza ku gihugu, byatumye abona neza igice cyacyo, kandi no kumenya ururimi rw'aho ni igice kinini muri ibyo.</s>

en: "When interviewing a minister or a displaced person or an activist, the most important element is getting their trust," she said. "If you're able to speak the language and make them feel comfortable from the beginning, it changes everything. It grants you a very beautiful kind of access."
kin: Ati: "Iyo ubajije minisitiri cyangwa umuntu wimuwe cyangwa umurwanashyaka, ikintu cy'ingenzi ni ukugirira icyizere." "Niba ushoboye kuvuga ururimi no gutuma bumva bamerewe neza kuva mu ntangiriro, bihindura byose. Iraguha uburyo bwiza cyane bwo kwinjira."
mt0: <pad> "Iyo uvuganye na Minisitiri cyangwa umuntu wahungabanyijwe cyangwa umunyapolitike, ikintu gikomeye ni ukuronka icyizere cyabo," yagize ati: "Ushobora kuvuga mu rurimi rwabo no gutuma bameze neza kuva mu ntangiriro, byose bihinduka. Byatuma ubona ko ufite uburyo bukomeye bwo gukora ibintu.</s>

en: In addition to Iraq and Lebanon, Gebeily, 30, has also traveled to Syria to cover the war against the Islamic State (IS) militant group.
kin: Usibye Iraki na Libani, Gebeily w'imyaka 30 yanagiye muri Siriya kugira ngo akurikirane intambara yo kurwanya umutwe w'abarwanyi ba Leta ya Kisilamu (IS).
mt0: <pad> In addition to Iraq and Lebanon, Gebeily, 30, has also traveled to Syria to cover the war against the Islamic State (IS) militant group.</s>

en: "Ive been very privileged to access some communities directly without having to work with a translator or a fixer, which also shapes the way that the stories come out," she said.
kin: Ati: "Ive nagize amahirwe yo kugera ku baturage mu buryo butaziguye ntiriwe nkorana n'umusemuzi cyangwa uwakosoye, ibyo bikaba binerekana uburyo inkuru zisohoka".
mt0: <pad> "Ndi umuntu w'umunyabwenge cyane kubasha kugerageza gukora ibintu bimwe na bimwe mu bice by'abaturage nta n'umwe ubafasha, ndetse bikagira ingaruka ku buryo inkuru zasohoka," yagize ati "Ibintu nkora ntibyahindura uko abantu bavuga ibiri mu rurimi rwabo."</s>

en: Syrian-Kurdish journalist Khabat Abbas, who has covered the war in Syria, attests to the importance of that.
kin: Umunyamakuru wa Siriya-Kurdiya, Khabat Abbas, wanditse ku ntambara yo muri Siriya, ahamya akamaro kayo.
mt0: <pad> Syria-Kurdish journalist Khabat Abbas, who has covered the war in Syria, attests to the importance of that.</s>

en: "Its knowing the language and the culture that gives people a sense of comfort to open up to you," she told VOA from Qamishli, Syria.
kin: Yatangarije VOA avuye i Qamishli, muri Siriya ati: "Kumenya ururimi n'umuco biha abantu ihumure ryo kukwugururira."
mt0: <pad> "Kuzi ururimi n'umuco biha abantu uburenganzira bwo kuvugana nawe," yabwiye VOA avuye i Qamishli, muri Syria.</s>

en: That knowledge helped when Abbas, 34, was on assignment with Sancha in March 2021. They traveled to a Kurdish-run detention camp in northeast Syria and interviewed female jihadists affiliated with IS, for a story in El Pais.
kin: Ubwo bumenyi bwafashije igihe Abbas w'imyaka 34 yari mu butumwa na Sancha muri Werurwe 2021. Baragiye mu kigo cy’imfungwa cy’Abanyakorde mu majyaruguru y’amajyaruguru ya Siriya maze babaza abajihadiste b’abagore bafitanye isano na IS, kugira ngo babone inkuru muri El Pais.
mt0: <pad> Bye bye ISIS!</s>

en: "While in Qamishli [in northeast Syria], I ran into two British journalists, very good colleagues of mine, who were disappointed after Shamima Begum and other women at the camp refused to talk to them," Sancha said, referring to a young woman who left her home in Britain aged 15 to join IS.
kin: Sancha yagize ati: "Nkiri i Qamishli [mu majyaruguru y'uburasirazuba bwa Siriya], nahungiye mu banyamakuru babiri b'Abongereza, abo dukorana cyane, batengushye nyuma yuko Shamima Begum n'abandi bagore bari mu nkambi banze kuvugana nabo." wavuye iwe mu Bwongereza afite imyaka 15 yinjira muri IS.
mt0: <pad> "Nkiri muri Qamishli [in northeast Syria], nahuriye n'abamenyeshamakuru b'Abanyamerika babiri, bagenzi banjye b'umunyamakuru, bakaba barababajwe nyuma y'aho Shamima Begum n'abandi bagore mu kigo cy'abarwayi banze kuvugana nabo," Sancha said.</s>

en: "Their fixer was a man, so the jihadist women didnt talk to them because they are radical, and they dont talk to men. But then I was able to sit with Shamima and other women, who gave fantastic interviews from inside their tents," Sancha said.
kin: "Umukosora wabo yari umugabo, ku buryo abagore ba jihadiste batavuganye nabo kubera ko ari intagondwa, kandi ntibavugana n'abagabo. Ariko rero nashoboye kwicarana na Shamima n'abandi bagore, batanga ibiganiro bitangaje bivuye mu mahema yabo." Sancha ati.
mt0: <pad> "Umukozi wabo yari umugabo, rero abagore b'abajihadi ntibahamagaye kuvugana na bo kuko ni aba radical, kandi ntabwo bavugana n'abagabo. Nyuma naje guhura na Shamima n'abandi bagore, bagira ibitekerezo byiza cyane mu bitanda byabo," Sancha yavuze.</s>

en: Abbas had a role in getting to talk to those women, she added.
kin: Yongeyeho ko Abbas yagize uruhare mu kubona abo bagore.
mt0: <pad> Abbas yari afite uruhare mu kuvugana n'abo bagore, yongeyeho.</s>

en: Unlike Sancha and Gebeily, Abbas grew up in the marginalized Kurdish region of Syria, where until the war began in 2011, journalism effectively didnt exist.
kin: Unlike Sancha and Gebeily, Abbas grew up in the marginalized Kurdish region of Syria, where until the war began in 2011, journalism effectively didnt exist.
mt0: <pad> Ntabwo nk'uko Sancha na Gebeily, Abbas yavukiye mu gice cya kure cyane cy'uturere twa Kurdi muri Siriya, aho kugeza mbere y'uko intambara ya 2011 itangira, nta makuru yari arihari.</s>

en: "Ordinary people in our region were used to seeing women pick up arms and fight, but they werent used to seeing a woman hold a camera on the streets and on front lines," Abbas said. "It took a lot of sacrificing for me to convince my family and society that Im as good, if not better, as my male colleagues."
kin: Bitandukanye na Sancha na Gebeily, Abbas yakuriye mu karere ka Siriya k’abasigajwe inyuma na Siriya, kugeza igihe intambara yatangiriye mu 2011, itangazamakuru ntiryabayeho.
mt0: <pad> "Abanyaburaya benshi ntibari bamenyereye kubona abagore bafata intwaro bagarutse mu gihugu, ariko ntabwo bari bamenyereye kubona abagore bafata kamera mu mihanda no mu nteko," Abbas said.</s>

en: Journalism appealed to her because the story of the Middle East has often been told by male journalists, both local and foreign.
kin: Itangazamakuru ryaramushimishije kubera ko inkuru yo mu burasirazuba bwo hagati yagiye ivugwa n'abanyamakuru b'abagabo, baba abo mu mahanga ndetse n'abanyamahanga.
mt0: <pad> Umunyamakuru yamuhaye igitekerezo kubera ko inkuru zo muri Moyen-Orient akenshi zatangazwa n'abagabo bavuga ibintu, yaba mu gihugu cyangwa hanze.</s>

en: "The narrative hasnt changed because of that, but if local and international women journalists get a real chance to tell the story of the Middle East, that narrative could change, which would affect the way others see this region," Abbas said.
kin: Abbas yagize ati: "Ibitekerezo ntabwo byahindutse kubera ibyo, ariko niba abanyamakuru b’abagore bo mu karere ndetse n’amahanga babonye amahirwe nyayo yo kuvuga amateka y’iburasirazuba bwo hagati, iyo nkuru ishobora guhinduka, ibyo bikaba byagira ingaruka ku kuntu abandi babona aka karere."
mt0: <pad> "Ibyo ntabwo byahinduye ibitekerezo, ariko niba abavuga rumwe n'abanyamakuru b'igitsina gore bafite amahirwe yo kuvuga inkuru ya Moyen Orient, icyo kitekerezo gishobora guhinduka, bigahindura uburyo abandi babona uyu mugabane," Abbas yavuze.</s>

en: Sancha also believes women in journalism have an impact on the way issues are viewed in the region, including post-traumatic stress disorder and the effect it has on female health, and subjects such as violence and alcohol.
kin: Sancha yizera kandi ko abagore mu itangazamakuru bagira ingaruka ku buryo ibibazo bigaragara mu karere, birimo ihungabana ry’ihungabana ndetse n’ingaruka bigira ku buzima bw’umugore, ndetse n’ihohoterwa n’inzoga.
mt0: <pad> Sancha believes women in journalism have an impact on the way issues are seen in the region, including post-traumatic stress disorder and the effect it has on female health, and subjects such as violence and alcohol.</s>

en: "We talk about all these issues that men normally wouldnt not speak about," she said.
kin: Ati: "Turaganira kuri ibyo bibazo byose abagabo ubusanzwe batavuga."
mt0: <pad> "Turaganira ku bintu byose umuntu utavugaho nk'uko abagabo bitabyovugaho," yagize ati.</s>

en: Iran's Guards Commander Says Israel Creating Conditions for Own Destruction
kin: Umuyobozi w'ingabo za Irani avuga ko Isiraheli ishyiraho uburyo bwo kurimbuka
mt0: <pad> Umugaba w'Ingabo za Irani avuga ko Israel iri gushyiraho ibintu byo kwica ubwe</s>

en: Israel's actions are creating conditions for its own destruction, Irans Revolutionary Guards commander on Friday told a Jerusalem Day rally at which the countrys new domestically-made Kheibar Buster missile was displayed.
kin: Ku wa gatanu, umuyobozi w’ingabo z’abasirikare barinda impinduramatwara ya Irans, yatangaje ko ibikorwa bya Isiraheli bitera uburyo bwo kurimbuka kwayo.
mt0: <pad> Israel igiye kwicisha bugufi, nk'uko umuntu utabizi abivuga.</s>

en: State television said millions of Iranians joined rallies marking Quds Day, the Arabic name for Jerusalem, in state-organized marches across the country.
kin: Televiziyo ya Leta yavuze ko miliyoni z'Abanyayirani bitabiriye imyigaragambyo yizihizaga umunsi wa Quds, izina ry'icyarabu ryitwa Yeruzalemu, mu rugendo rwateguwe na leta mu gihugu hose.
mt0: <pad> Milioni z'Abanyairani baje mu mihanda kugira ngo bashimike Umunsi wa Quds, Arabic name for Jerusalem, mu mihanda yateguwe n'igihugu mu gihugu cyose.</s>

en: It showed the Israeli flag being set on fire and groups of people around the country shouting choreographed "Death to America, Death to Israel" slogans.
kin: Yerekanye ibendera rya Isiraheli ritwikwa hamwe nitsinda ryabantu hirya no hino basakuza koreografiya "Urupfu muri Amerika, Urupfu kuri Isiraheli".
mt0: <pad> It showed the Israeli flag being set on fire and groups of people around the country shouting choreographed "Death to America, Death to Israel" slogans.</s>

en: Supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said in a televised speech that anti-Israeli protests and attacks showed that Palestinians rejected compromises by Arab authorities with Israel.
kin: Umuyobozi w'ikirenga, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, mu ijambo rye kuri televiziyo yavuze ko imyigaragambyo n'ibitero byo kurwanya Isiraheli byerekanaga ko Abanyapalestine banze kumvikana n'abayobozi b'Abarabu na Isiraheli.
mt0: <pad> Ayatollah Ali Khamenei says in a televised speech that anti-Israeli protests and attacks showed that Palestinians rejected compromises by Arab authorities with Israel.</s>

en: Opposition to Israel is a touchstone of belief for Iran, which backs Palestinian and Lebanese Islamist militant groups opposed to peace with Israel, which Tehran does not recognize.
kin: Kurwanya Isiraheli ni ibuye rikomeye ku myizerere ya Irani, ishyigikiye imitwe yitwara gisirikare ya kisilamu ya Palesitine na Libani irwanya amahoro na Isiraheli, Tehran ikaba itemera.
mt0: <pad> Kuvuga ko utabizi ni ukuvuga ko utabizi</s>

en: "What has happened in Palestine in recent years annuls all plans for compromise with the Zionist enemy (Israel) because no plan for Palestine can be implemented in the absence or contrary to the opinions of its owners, the Palestinians," Khamenei said, speaking in Arabic and addressing Palestinians and other Arabs.
kin: Mu magambo ye, Khamenei yagize ati: "Ibyabereye muri Palesitine mu myaka yashize bivanaho gahunda zose zo kumvikana n’umwanzi w’abaziyoniste (Isiraheli) kuko nta gahunda ya Palesitine ishobora gushyirwa mu bikorwa idahari cyangwa binyuranye n’ibitekerezo bya ba nyirayo, Abanyapalestine". Icyarabu no kuvugana nabanyapalestine nabandi barabu.
mt0: <pad> "Ibintu byabaye muri Palestine mu myaka yashize birasubiza inyuma ibikorwa byo gufatanya na Israel kubera ko nta gahunda yo gutera imbere Palestine ishobora gushyirwa mu bikorwa nta n'umwe ufite ibitekerezo bye, abaturage ba Palestine," Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said in an interview with the Arab news agency.</s>

en: Thus, Khamenei said, all previous peace agreements -- such as the 1993 Oslo Accords, the two-state solution to resolve the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, and former U.S. President Donald Trump's plan dubbed the Deal of the Century "are null and void".
kin: Ni yo mpamvu, Khamenei yavuze ko amasezerano y’amahoro yabanjirije aya - nk’amasezerano ya Oslo yo mu 1993, igisubizo cy’ibihugu byombi kugira ngo gikemure amakimbirane hagati ya Isiraheli na Palesitine, ndetse n’umugambi wahoze ari Perezida wa Leta zunze ubumwe za Amerika, Donald Trump wise amasezerano y’ikinyejana "nta gaciro ufite."
mt0: <pad> Bye bye Deal of the Century.</s>

en: President Ebrahim Raisi, Irans military commanders and senior officials also attended the rallies in which people were allowed to march through the streets, the first time since the outbreak of the coronavirus pandemic two years ago.
kin: Perezida Ebrahim Raisi, abayobozi b'ingabo za Irans n'abayobozi bakuru na bo bitabiriye imyigaragambyo aho abantu bemerewe kugenda mu mihanda, ku nshuro ya mbere kuva icyorezo cya coronavirus gitangira mu myaka ibiri ishize.
mt0: <pad> Perezida Ebrahim Raisi, abakuru b'ingabo n'abandi bakozi bakuru b'igihugu nabo bitabiriye imihango yagaragaye mu mijyi, ku nshuro ya mbere kuva coronavirus pandemic yatangira muri Iran imyaka ibiri ishize.</s>

en: Iran's Jerusalem Day rallies are held annually in support of Palestinians, who want East Jerusalem as the capital of a future state in territories captured by Israel in a 1967 war, on the last Friday of the Muslim fasting month of Ramadan.
kin: Igiterane cy’umunsi wa Yeruzalemu cya Irani kiba buri mwaka mu rwego rwo gushyigikira Abanyapalestine, bifuza ko Yeruzalemu y’iburasirazuba iba umurwa mukuru w’igihugu kizaza mu turere twafashwe na Isiraheli mu ntambara yo mu 1967, ku wa gatanu wanyuma w’ukwezi kwa Ramazani kwisonzesha kw’abayisilamu.
mt0: <pad> Iran ikoresha imyigaragambyo ya Jerusalem Day buri mwaka mu gushyigikira Abanyapalestinians, bashaka ko Yeruzalemu y'Amajyepfo ari umurwa mukuru w'igihugu cyabo gishya mu bice byashizweho n'Isirayeli mu Ntambara ya 1967, ku wa Gatandatu wa nyuma w'ukwezi kwa Ramadan, ku wa Mbere w'Umunsi w'Umwuka w'Abanyislamu.</s>

en: "Stop your vicious deeds. You know well that we are people of action and reaction," Revolutionary Guards commander Hossein Salami, addressing Israel, told demonstrators in Tehran.
kin: Umuyobozi w'ingabo zishinzwe impinduramatwara, Hossein Salami, yabwiye Isiraheli, yabwiye abigaragambyaga i Tehran ati: "Hagarika ibikorwa byawe bibi. Uzi neza ko turi abantu bakora kandi bakitwara neza."
mt0: <pad> "Muhagarike ibikorwa byawe bibi. Mumenye neza ko turi abantu b'igikorwa n'ibisubizo," the Revolutionary Guards commander Hossein Salami told demonstrators in Tehran.</s>

en: "Our responses are painful. You create conditions for your own destruction. We will not leave you alone ...You know better than me what will befall you if you take evil action."
kin: "Ibisubizo byacu birababaje. Ushiraho uburyo bwo kurimbuka kwawe. Ntabwo tuzagutererana wenyine ... Uzi kundusha ibizakubaho uramutse ufashe nabi."
mt0: <pad> "Ibintu byawe ni ibibi. Ukora ibintu kugira ngo ubone ubuzima bwawe. Tutakureka... uzi neza kuruta jye icyo uzabona niba ufashe igikorwa kibi."</s>

en: Iran's military has vowed to retaliate harshly against any attack by Israel, which has often voiced concern over the Iranian nuclear program. Tehran says the program is for peaceful purposes only.
kin: Igisirikare cya Irani cyiyemeje kwihorera bikabije igitero icyo ari cyo cyose cyagabwe na Isiraheli, cyakunze kugaragaza impungenge kuri gahunda ya kirimbuzi ya Irani. Tehran ivuga ko gahunda igamije amahoro gusa.
mt0: <pad> Iran yatangaje ko itegeka Israel kwishyura cyane ku bitero byayo, ikaba yaravuze ko itegeka Israel kwishyura cyane ku bitero byayo. Tehran ivuga ko itegeka Israel kwishyura cyane ku bitero byayo by'umutekano gusa.</s>

en: Israel, whose existence the Islamic Republic does not recognize, has long threatened military action against Iran if talks between Tehran and world powers fail to curb Iranian nuclear activity. Iran says its nuclear ambitions are peaceful.
kin: Isiraheli, repubulika ya kisilamu itabaho, imaze igihe kinini itera ubwoba ibikorwa bya gisirikare byo kurwanya Irani niba ibiganiro hagati ya Tehran n’ibihugu by’ibihugu bidashoboye guhagarika ibikorwa bya kirimbuzi bya Irani. Irani ivuga ko intego zayo za kirimbuzi ari amahoro.
mt0: <pad> Israel, igihugu Iran itemera, yatanze ubutegetsi bw'ingabo ku gihugu cya Iran mu gihe cy'imyaka myinshi ivuga ko nta masezerano y'amahoro ashoboka hagati yayo n'ibihugu by'isi. Iran ivuga ko intego zayo zo gukora ibikoresho bya kirimbuzi ni amahoro.</s>

en: In February, the Islamic Republic unveiled its "Kheibar Buster" missile with a range of 1,450 km (900 miles).
kin: Muri Gashyantare, Repubulika ya Kisilamu yashyize ahagaragara misile yayo "Kheibar Buster" ifite uburebure bwa kilometero 1,450.
mt0: <pad> Mu kwezi kwa 2, Repubulika y'Idini ya Islamu yashyize hanze "Kheibar Buster" missile ifite urugendo rw'ibilometero 1,450 (mayili 900) n'uburebure bw'ibilometero 900.</s>

en: Iran, which has one of the biggest missile programs in the Middle East, says its ballistic missiles have a range of up to 2,000 km (1,200 miles) and are capable of reaching its arch-foe Israel and U.S. bases in the region.
kin: Irani, ifite imwe muri gahunda zikomeye za misile mu burasirazuba bwo hagati, ivuga ko misile zayo zo mu bwoko bwa ballistique zifite uburebure bwa kilometero zigera ku 2.000 kandi ko zishobora kugera ku birindiro byazo bya Isiraheli ndetse n'ibirindiro by’Amerika muri ako karere.
mt0: <pad> Iran, ifite umwe mu migambi ya missile myinshi muri Moyen Orient, ivuga ko imijugujugu yayo ishobora kugera kuri kilometero 2000 (mayili 1200) kandi ishobora gukora ibitero bya rukuruzi Israel na base za Amerika muri ako karere.</s>

en: Kheibar refers to an ancient Jewish oasis in the Arabian Peninsula's Hijaz region that was overrun by Muslim warriors in the 7th century.
kin: Kheibar bivuga oasisi ya kera y'Abayahudi yo mu gace ka Hijaz ka Arabiya y’Abarabu yigaruriwe n'abarwanyi b'Abayisilamu mu kinyejana cya 7.
mt0: <pad> Kheibar ni ahantu ha kera ha gikirisitu mu gace ka Hijaz mu majyaruguru y'Afurika ya Arabia, hashobora kuba hari n'ubuyapani bwari bwarugawe n'ingabo z'Abanyamudugudu mu kinyejana cya 7</s>

en: Tehran regards its ballistic missile program as an important deterrent against the United States, Israel and other adversaries, and has rejected Western demands to halt it.
kin: Tehran ibona gahunda yayo ya misile ballistique nk'ikintu gikomeye cyo gukumira Amerika, Isiraheli ndetse n'abanzi bayo, kandi yanze icyifuzo cy'iburengerazuba cyo kuyihagarika.
mt0: <pad> Tehran abona ko ibikorwa byayo by'ibisasu bya ballistic missile ari kimwe mu bikoresho bikomeye ku gihugu cye, Israel na bagenzi be, kandi yaremeje ibitekerezo by'ibihugu by'amahanga byo guhagarika ibikorwa byayo.</s>

en: Over the past year, Iran and the United States have engaged in fitful, indirect talks in Vienna to revive a 2015 nuclear deal that then-President Donald Trump reneged on in 2018 and that Iran, in turn, began violating in 2019.
kin: Mu mwaka ushize, Irani na Amerika byaganiriye na Vienne mu biganiro bifatika kandi bitaziguye kugira ngo byongere kubyutsa amasezerano ya kirimbuzi yo muri 2015 icyo gihe Perezida Donald Trump yanze kuva muri 2018 kandi ko Irani nayo yatangiye kurenga muri 2019.
mt0: <pad> Icyumweru gishize, Iran na Leta Zunze Ubumwe za Amerika bagiye mu biganiro by'amarenga, bibangamiye, muri Vienne kugira ngo basubire ku masezerano ya 2015 y'ibyuma bikoroza ibikomere ubwato.</s>

en: Under the 2015 deal, Iran agreed to limit its nuclear program in return for relief from economic sanctions.
kin: Mu masezerano ya 2015, Irani yemeye kugabanya gahunda zayo za kirimbuzi mu rwego rwo gukuraho ibihano by’ubukungu.
mt0: <pad> Under the 2015 deal, Iran agreed to limit its nuclear program in return for relief from economic sanctions.</s>

en: While they appeared close to resurrecting the deal in March, talks stalled over last-minute Russian demands and whether Washington might drop Iran's Revolutionary Guards from its Foreign Terrorist Organization list.
kin: Mu gihe basaga nkaho bari hafi kubyutsa ayo masezerano muri Werurwe, ibiganiro byahagaritse icyifuzo cy’Uburusiya ku munota wa nyuma ndetse n’uko Washington ishobora gukuraho abashinzwe umutekano w’impinduramatwara ya Irani ku rutonde rw’umuryango w’iterabwoba w’amahanga.
mt0: <pad> Naho ugaragara ko hafi gusubiramo ibiganiro muri Werurwe, imibonano mpuzabitsina yaguye kubera ibibazo by'iminsi y'imperuka by'Uburusiya n'uko Washington ishobora gukura ingabo z'Imihiririzo za Iran mu rutonde rw'ibigwi by'iterabwoba.</s>

en: As Fewer Americans Attend Church, Can Coffee Shops Fill the Void?
kin: Nk'uko Abanyamerika bake Bajya mu Itorero, Amaduka ya Kawa Yuzuza Icyuho?
mt0: <pad> Bye bye coffee shop</s>

en: Churches and other houses of worship have historically played critical social and political functions in American society.
kin: Amatorero n'andi mazu asengeramo yagiye akora amateka akomeye mubikorwa bya politiki na politiki muri societe y'Abanyamerika.
mt0: <pad> Amashyamba n'andi madini yagize uruhare runaka mu mibereho myiza n'imibereho myiza y'abanya Amerika.</s>

en: But fewer people are attending religious services, and the decline of churches and other houses of worship threatens to leave a void that could potentially be filled by coffee shops.
kin: Ariko abantu bake ni bo bitabira ibikorwa by’amadini, kandi kugabanuka kwamatorero nandi mazu yo gusengeramo bikangisha gusiga icyuho gishobora kuzuzwa n'amaduka ya kawa.
mt0: <pad> Ariko abantu bake bagenda mu materaniro ya gidini, kandi ubwinshi bw'amadini n'andi matorero biratinya ko hashobora kubaho umwanya ushobora gufatwa na resitora.</s>

en: "For so much of American history, the church has really been — or their congregations have really been — essential, providing an unheralded role in providing cohesion and connectedness in communities … encouraging civic engagement and political participation," says Daniel Cox, director of the Survey Center on American Life and a senior fellow at the American Enterprise Institute.
kin: Umuyobozi w'ikigo, Daniel Cox agira ati: "Mu mateka menshi y'Abanyamerika, itorero ryabaye - cyangwa amatorero yabo yabaye ngombwa - kugira uruhare rudasanzwe mu gutanga ubumwe no guhuza abaturage… gushishikariza uruhare rw'abaturage no kugira uruhare muri politiki." Ubushakashatsi ku Buzima bw'Abanyamerika na mugenzi wawe mukuru muri American Enterprise Institute.
mt0: <pad> "Mu mateka y'Amerika, itorero ryagize uruhare runini cyane, rutanga ubumwe n'umubano mu bice... guhamagarira abantu kwitabira imirimo ya politiki no gutanga ibitekerezo byabo," Daniel Cox, umuyobozi w'Ikigo cy'Isura ku Buzima bw'Abanyamerika n'umunyabushakashatsi mukuru muri American Enterprise Institute.</s>

en: "It was not happenstance or luck that the civil rights movement emerged out of the church," Cox says.
kin: Cox agira ati: "Ntabwo byari ibintu by'uruhurirane cyangwa amahirwe kuba umuryango uharanira uburenganzira bwa muntu wavuye mu itorero."
mt0: <pad> "Ntabwo byabaye mu rwihishwa cyangwa mu buhe butsinzi ko iyerekwa ry'uburenganzira bw'abaturage ryasohotse mu itorero," Cox says.</s>

en: "And you see that cross-culturally … whether it's in predominantly white rural communities, in the suburbs, wherever, churches have historically been really, really important."
kin: "Kandi urabona ko imico itandukanye… haba mu baturage biganjemo abazungu bo mu cyaro, mu nkengero, ahantu hose, amatorero yabaye amateka mu by'ukuri, ni ngombwa."
mt0: <pad> "N'ubwo ubona ko mu bice byinshi by'umuco... yaba mu bice by'amashyamba cyangwa mu bice by'imidugudu, aho ariho hose, amadini yagize akamaro kenshi, kenshi cyane mu mateka.</s>

en: Churches and other houses of worship have also played a role in helping immigrants assimilate once they arrive in America, Cox says.
kin: Cox avuga ko amatorero n'andi mazu asengeramo nabyo byagize uruhare mu gufasha abimukira kwimuka bamaze kugera muri Amerika.
mt0: <pad> Kiliziya n'andi madini kandi na yo yagize uruhare runaka mu gufasha abavuga ururimi bamwe n'abandi bavuga ururimi bamwe ubwo bazaba bageze muri Amerika, Cox avuga.</s>

en: In 1999, 70% of Americans said they belonged to a church, mosque or synagogue.
kin: Mu 1999, 70% by'Abanyamerika bavuze ko bari mu rusengero, umusigiti cyangwa mu isinagogi.
mt0: <pad> In 1999, 70% of Americans said they belonged to a church, mosque or synagogue.</s>

en: By 2020, that number had dropped to 47%. A 2019 survey found that only about three in 10 Americans say they attend weekly religious services.
kin: Muri 2020, iyo mibare yari yagabanutse kugera kuri 47%. Ubushakashatsi bwakozwe mu mwaka wa 2019 bwerekanye ko Abanyamerika bagera kuri batatu gusa ari bo bavuga ko bitabira amadini ya buri cyumweru.
mt0: <pad> By 2020, icyo gipimo cyagabanutse kugera kuri 47%. A 2019 survey found that only about three in 10 Americans say they attend weekly religious services.</s>

en: Third places Lack of involvement and affiliation with churches, mosques and synagogues means people might be missing out on what urban sociologist Ray Oldenburg dubbed as "third places" — public gathering spots that offer something that home, the "first place," and work, the "second place," might not.
kin: Umwanya wa gatatu Kutagira uruhare no gufatanya n'amatorero, imisigiti n'amasinagogi bivuze ko abantu bashobora kubura icyo umuhanga mubya societologue wo mumijyi Ray Oldenburg yise "umwanya wa gatatu" - ahantu hateranira abantu benshi batanga ikintu murugo, "umwanya wa mbere," nakazi, "umwanya wa kabiri," ntabwo.
mt0: <pad> Third places Ibura ry'uruhare n'imikorere mu rusengero, mu mosozi no mu cyubahiro bivuze ko abantu bashobora kuba bataragerageza ibibanza bya gatatu — ahantu ha rusange umuntu ashobora gukusanyikiraho ibintu ntabwo imuhira, icya mbere, n'akazi, icya kabiri, ishobora gutanga.</s>

en: Oldenburg argued that third places are critical to a communitys social vitality.
kin: Oldenburg yavuze ko umwanya wa gatatu ari ingenzi ku mibereho y'abaturage.
mt0: <pad> Oldenburg yavugaga ko ahantu ha gatatu ni ngombwa kugira ubuzima bw'umudugudu.</s>

en: An October 2021 survey conducted by the American Survey Center found that commercial spaces like coffee houses foster trust and connection in American communities and could help fill the void left by churches.
kin: Ubushakashatsi bwakozwe mu Kwakira 2021 bwakozwe n’ikigo cy’Abanyamerika gishinzwe ubushakashatsi bwerekanye ko ahantu h’ubucuruzi nk’amazu ya kawa bitera kwizerana no guhuza imiryango y'Abanyamerika kandi bikaba byafasha kuziba icyuho cyasizwe n'amatorero.
mt0: <pad> Amakuru yagaragajwe muri October 2021 n'Ikigo cy'Ibarura ry'Abanyamerika kivuga ko inzu z'ubucuruzi nka resitora zifasha gukubita umutego w'amadini mu bice by'abaturage b'Amerika kandi zishobora gutuma abantu bagerageza kwifashisha imirimo y'idini.</s>

en: "If you're a regular at a cafe, the barista may know what you usually order, and they can make it for you, and that feels good," says clinical psychologist Dr. Maria Espinola, an assistant professor in the Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Neuroscience at the University of Cincinnati College of Medicine.
kin: Inzobere mu by'imitekerereze ya muntu, Dr. Maria Espinola, umwarimu wungirije mu ishami ry’indwara zo mu mutwe, agira ati: "Niba usanzwe muri cafe, barista irashobora kumenya icyo usanzwe utumiza, kandi barashobora kukugukorera, kandi ibyo ni byiza." na Neuroscience Imyitwarire muri kaminuza ya Cincinnati College of Medicine.
mt0: <pad> "Iyo uri umukunda kunywa ikawa, barista ashobora kumenya ibyo ukunda gusaba, kandi bashobora guteka byawe, kandi icyo kintu gituma wumva neza."</s>

en: "It feels good to be recognized, to know that people are expecting you, to know that people care about you, to know that you belong, because the need for belonging and human connection is a fundamental need that we all have, and it's important to have that fulfilled in different ways," Espinola says.
kin: "Ni byiza kumenyekana, kumenya ko abantu bagutegereje, kumenya ko abantu bakwitayeho, kumenya ko uri uwawe, kuko gukenera kuba hamwe no guhuza abantu nikintu cyibanze twese dufite, kandi ni ngombwa kugira ngo ibyo bisohozwe mu buryo butandukanye, "Espinola.
mt0: <pad> "Ibintu byiza ni uko umuntu abona ko abantu bakwitega, ko abantu bahangayikishwa nawe, ko abantu bikunda, ko umuntu ashaka kumenya ko uriho, kuko icyo kibazo cy'ubuzima n'umubano w'abantu ni ikibazo gikomeye buri wese afite, kandi icyo kibazo gikomeye ni uko icyo kibazo gisubizwa mu buryo butandukanye," Espinola says.</s>

en: "So, places like third places can allow us to do that."
kin: "Rero, ahantu nka gatatu harashobora kutwemerera kubikora."
mt0: <pad> "Bityo, ahantu nk'aho hari ibice bya gatatu bishobora gutuma dushobora gukora ibyo."</s>

en: In the past, churches and other houses of worship have been a third place for many Americans.
kin: Mu bihe byashize, amatorero n'andi mazu yo gusengeramo yabaye umwanya wa gatatu ku Banyamerika benshi.
mt0: <pad> Mu gihe cyashize, urusengero n'andi mazu yo gusenga yabaye ahantu ha gatatu ku banyamerika benshi.</s>

en: In 2019, 67% of people surveyed said they have a third place — a coffee shop, bar, restaurant, park or other place in their community that they visit regularly.
kin: Muri 2019, 67% by'abantu babajijwe bavuze ko bafite umwanya wa gatatu - iduka rya kawa, akabari, resitora, parike cyangwa ahandi hantu basura buri gihe.
mt0: <pad> In 2019, 67% by'abantu babajijwe bavuga ko bafite ahantu ha gatatu — a coffee shop, bar, restaurant, park or other place in their community that they visit regularly.</s>

en: That number dropped to 56% in 2021 — a number that could have been affected by the COVID-19 pandemic.
kin: Umubare wagabanutse kugera kuri 56% muri 2021 - umubare washoboraga kwanduzwa nicyorezo cya COVID-19.
mt0: <pad> Iyo mibare yagabanutse ku rugero rwa 56% muri 2021 — urugero rushobora kuba rwarahinduwe n'icyorezo cya COVID-19.</s>

en: "What we found was that people who had a third place were much more connected to their community," says Cox. "They're much more likely to engage in other activities there.
kin: Cox agira ati: "Icyo twabonye ni uko abantu bafite umwanya wa gatatu bari bahuze cyane n'abaturage babo". "Birashoboka cyane ko bakora ibikorwa bindi.
mt0: <pad> "Ibintu twagaragaje ni uko abantu bafite ahantu ha gatatu bari benshi mu gihugu cyabo, nk'uko Cox abivuga. "Bari benshi mu gihugu cyabo kurusha abandi gukora ibindi bikorwa byo mu gihugu."</s>

en: They are much more trusting of their neighbors. There's a whole great array of positive social outcomes that were connected to having a third place … and for a lot of Americans, it's a coffee shop or a cafe."
kin: Barizera cyane abaturanyi babo. Hano hari byinshi byiza byagezweho mu mibereho bifitanye isano no kugira umwanya wa gatatu… kandi ku Banyamerika benshi, ni ikawa cyangwa ikawa. "
mt0: <pad> Abantu benshi ntibatinya bagenzi babo. Hariho urukurikirane rw'ibihe byiza bya sosiyete bifitanye isano no kuba hari icyiciro cya gatatu... kandi ku banyamerika benshi, ni ubwato cyangwa kafe.</s>

en: What coffee shops have in their favor is that they can be found almost everywhere, all over the country, and anyone who wants to can stop by regularly.
kin: Icyo amaduka yikawa abifitemo inyungu nuko ashobora kuboneka hafi ya hose, mugihugu cyose, kandi umuntu wese ubishaka ashobora guhagarara buri gihe.
mt0: <pad> Ibiro by'ikawa bifite icyo bitanga ni uko biri hafi ahantu hose mu gihugu, kandi buri wese ushaka ashobora kugenderamo kenshi.</s>

en: And many are open most days of the week.
kin: Kandi benshi barakinguye iminsi myinshi yicyumweru.
mt0: <pad> Kandi nyinshi zitanga akazi ku munsi wose w'icyumweru.</s>

en: Cox says even brief coffee shop encounters can increase a sense of belonging.
kin: Cox avuga ko no guhura kwa kawa bigufi bishobora kongera imyumvire.
mt0: <pad> Cox says even short encounters in coffee shops can increase a sense of belonging.</s>

en: "I think there's a lot of potential here, and a lot of it is unrealized potential," Cox says.
kin: Cox agira ati: "Ntekereza ko hano hari byinshi bishoboka, kandi ibyinshi muri byo ntabwo bishoboka."
mt0: <pad> "Ntekereza ko hari imbaraga nyinshi hano, kandi nyinshi muri zo ni imbaraga zitagezeho," Cox says.</s>

en: "But in terms of what they could do, there's a lot there.
kin: "Ariko ukurikije ibyo bashoboraga gukora, hano hari byinshi.
mt0: <pad> "Ariko mu byo bashobora gukora, hariho ibindi byinshi."</s>

en: I've been in places where the same group of folks come in there to play chess.
kin: Nabaye ahantu itsinda rimwe ryabantu baza ngaho gukina chess.
mt0: <pad> Ngeze mu hantu aho abantu bamwe baza gukinira umupira w'amakofe.</s>

en: Or they have their informal bunch of retirees. … They just got together, and they talked and chatted and caught up with each other. … I don't know where else they would have gone — maybe a church, but maybe not — to share information, to encourage each other to maybe get involved in an activity.
kin: Cyangwa bafite udutsiko twabo twabasezeye. … Bahuye gusa, baraganira baraganira kandi bafatana. Sinzi aho bari kuba bagiye - ahari itorero, ariko birashoboka ko atari - gusangira amakuru, gushishikarizanya wenda kwishora mubikorwa.
mt0: <pad> Ariko hari n'abandi bagenzi bakiri bato bagiye hamwe,... Bagiye hamwe, bagatembera, bagavugana, bagafatanya ibitekerezo.... Sinzi aho abandi bajyaga — ashobora kuba mu rusengero, ariko ntibizi — kugira ngo basangize amakuru, kugira ngo bashishikarire umwe n'undi gukora igikorwa.</s>

en: And I think that is what is so powerful about coffee shops."
kin: Kandi ndatekereza ko ari cyo gikomeye cyane mu bubiko bwa kawa. "
mt0: <pad> Ntekereza ko ari byo bintu bikomeye cyane ku bibuga by'amafunguro ya kafe.</s>

en: What US Mayors Are Most Worried About After the Pandemic
kin: Ibyo abayobozi ba Amerika bahangayikishijwe cyane na byo nyuma y'icyorezo
mt0: <pad> Bye bye covid-19: What US mayors are most worried about after the pandemic</s>

en: Americas mayors are most concerned about the lingering mental health effects of the COVID-19 pandemic, according to a nationwide survey of 126 mayors conducted during the summer of 2021.
kin: Abayobozi ba Amerika bahangayikishijwe cyane n’ingaruka ziterwa n’ubuzima bwo mu mutwe bw’icyorezo cya COVID-19, nk’uko ubushakashatsi bwakozwe mu gihugu hose bwakorewe ku bayobozi 126 bwakozwe mu mpeshyi ya 2021.
mt0: <pad> Americas mayors are most concerned about the lingering mental health effects of the COVID-19 pandemic, according to a nationwide survey of 126 mayors conducted during the summer of 2021.</s>

en: The respondents headed cities with at least 75,000 residents. The local leaders are still focused on traditional issues such as violent crime, the economy and infrastructure, but they are most concerned about the pandemics long-term impact on the mental health of their constituents.
kin: Ababajijwe bayoboye imijyi byibuze abaturage 75.000. Abayobozi b'inzego z'ibanze baracyibanda ku bibazo gakondo nk'ibyaha by'urugomo, ubukungu n'ibikorwa remezo, ariko bahangayikishijwe cyane n'ingaruka z'icyorezo ku buzima bwo mu mutwe bw'abatoye.
mt0: <pad> Abasubiza bose bafite abaturage bagera kuri 75,000. Abayobozi b'ibigo byabo ntibavuga ko ari bo bifite ibibazo bisanzwe nk'ihohoterwa, ubukungu n'inyubako, ariko bashishikajwe cyane n'ingaruka y'igihe kirekire y'icyorezo ku buzima bw'abaturage babo.</s>

en: Mental health was top of mind for Michael Udine when he was sworn in as mayor of Broward County, Florida, in November 2021.
kin: Ubuzima bwo mu mutwe bwibanze kuri Michael Udine ubwo yarahiraga kuba umuyobozi w’intara ya Broward, muri Floride, mu Gushyingo 2021.
mt0: <pad> Bye bye mental health, Michael Udine when he was sworn in as mayor of Broward County, Florida, in November 2021.</s>

en: "Everything that was a potential issue pre-pandemic has pretty much been exacerbated by the pandemic," he says.
kin: Agira ati: "Ikintu cyose cyashoboraga kuba ikibazo mbere y’icyorezo cyarushijeho kwiyongera kubera icyorezo."
mt0: <pad> "Ibintu byose byashoboraga kuba ikibazo mbere y'uko icyorezo cya coronavirus kizaba, byagize ingaruka mbi cyane kubera icyorezo cya coronavirus," aravuga.</s>

en: "There were issues going into the pandemic, and it was becoming more and more important on everyone's radar screen about the mental health of people of all ages. And I think the pandemic pretty much supercharged those issues."
kin: "Hariho ibibazo byagiye mu cyorezo, kandi byagendaga birushaho kuba ingenzi kuri ecran ya radar ya buri muntu ku bijyanye n'ubuzima bwo mu mutwe bw'abantu b'ingeri zose. Kandi ndatekereza ko icyorezo cyarenze ibyo bibazo."
mt0: <pad> "Hari ibibazo mbere y'uko icyorezo cya coronavirus kiba, kandi byagendaga biba byinshi ku bantu b'ingeri zose ku bijyanye n'umutekano w'abantu bose. Ntekereza ko icyorezo cya coronavirus cyongereye cyane ibyo bibazo."</s>

en: It is not unusual for large outbreaks of disease to have a negative impact on mental health, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, which reports that rates of anxiety and depressive disorders among adults increased during the pandemic.
kin: Ntibisanzwe ko icyorezo kinini cy’indwara kigira ingaruka mbi ku buzima bwo mu mutwe, nk’uko ikigo gishinzwe kurwanya no gukumira indwara kibitangaza, ngo raporo y’uko abantu bahangayitse ndetse n’indwara yo kwiheba yiyongera mu gihe cy’icyorezo.
mt0: <pad> It is not unusual for large outbreaks of disease to have a negative impact on mental health, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, which reports that rates of anxiety and depressive disorders among adults increased during the pandemic.</s>

en: The pandemic has also adversely influenced the emotional and mental health of about one-third of Americas youth.
kin: Icyorezo kandi cyagize ingaruka mbi ku buzima bw'amarangamutima no mu mutwe by'urubyiruko rwo muri Amerika.
mt0: <pad> Pandemic has also adversely affected the emotional and mental health of about one-third of Americas youth.</s>

en: "What we've seen is just such anxiety, kids who wouldn't ordinarily have a meltdown, because it's so much change and difficulty adjusting to transitions," Maryland psychologist Mary Karapetian Alvord told VOA last month. "We've also seen a lot more sadness and depression."
kin: Mu kwezi gushize, umuhanga mu by'imitekerereze ya muntu witwa Maryland, Mary Karapetian, Alvord, yabwiye ibiro ntaramakuru by'Abanyamerika ati: "Ibyo twabonye ni impungenge nk'izo, abana badakunze kugira ikibazo cyo gushonga, kubera ko ari impinduka nyinshi kandi bigoye guhindura inzibacyuho." "Twabonye kandi umubabaro mwinshi no kwiheba."
mt0: <pad> "Ibintu tubona ni ubwoba, abana batabwirizwa kugira amikoro menshi, kubera ko ari byinshi byahindutse kandi bigatuma bigorana no guhindura ibintu," umunyabumenyi Mary Karapetian Alvord yabwiye VOA mu kwezi gushize. "Tubona kandi n'umubabaro n'ubumuga bwinshi, kubera ko ntabwo abantu benshi bafite ubuzima bwiza."</s>

en: Early on in the pandemic, mayors were more focused on city operations, budget shortfalls and the threat the pandemic posed to small businesses, according to David Glick, an associate professor of political science at Boston University and a co-author of the 2021 Menino Survey of Mayors.
kin: Nk’uko byatangajwe na David Glick, umwarimu wungirije wa siyanse ya politiki muri kaminuza ya Boston, akaba n'umwanditsi umwe w’ubushakashatsi bwakozwe na Menino 2021, nk'uko byatangajwe na David Glick, umwarimu wungirije ushinzwe ubushakashatsi mu bya politiki, nk'uko byatangajwe na David Glick.
mt0: <pad> Mu ntangiriro z'icyorezo, abatware bavuga ko bari bahangayikishijwe no gukora imirimo ya leta, ubukungu bubura no kugira ngo icyorezo kifashe mu gutera imbere imirimo mito, David Glick, umwigisha w'umunyapolitike muri kaminuza ya Boston na co-author wa 2021 Menino Survey of Mayors.</s>

en: "Some of those concerns still remain, but what we saw more of in 2021 … is concern about some of the long-term impacts on individual residents," Glick says.
kin: Glick agira ati: "Zimwe muri izo mpungenge ziracyahari, ariko ibyo twabonye byinshi mu 2021… ni impungenge z'ingaruka z'igihe kirekire ku baturage ku giti cyabo."
mt0: <pad> "Bimwe muri ibyo bibazo birahari, ariko ibigaragara cyane muri 2021... ni ubwoba ku ingaruka ndende zabyo ku baturage bwite," Glick avuga.</s>

en: "Concerns about polarization over vaccines and just people being pushed to their limits … and certainly less on their city budgets and revenues and having to cut programs and some of those types of things that were probably more top of mind earlier in the pandemic."
kin: "Guhangayikishwa no gukingira inkingo ndetse n'abantu basunikwa ku mipaka yabo… kandi rwose ni bike ku ngengo y’imari y’umujyi n’amafaranga yinjira ndetse no kugabanya gahunda ndetse na bimwe muri ibyo bintu byashobokaga kuba byaragaragaye mbere mu cyorezo."
mt0: <pad> "Ibibazo by'ukwikubita ku bikoresho n'abantu bagenda bagera mu mpera za bo... noneho ntabwo ari uko amafaranga y'umujyi n'ibiciro byayo ndetse no gukuramo imirimo n'ubwoko bw'ibindi bintu byinshi byari biri hejuru cyane muri iki gihe cya pandemic."</s>

en: Over half of mayors, 52%, are worried about "lingering mental health challenges and trauma," according to the survey.
kin: Ubushakashatsi buvuga ko kimwe cya kabiri cy’abayobozi, 52%, bahangayikishijwe n’ikibazo cy’ubuzima bwo mu mutwe n’ihungabana.
mt0: <pad> Mayors are worried about "lingering mental health challenges and trauma," the survey said.</s>

en: Additionally, more than one-third of mayors, 37%, are worried about learning loss among young people.
kin: Byongeye kandi, kimwe cya gatatu cyabayobozi, 37%, bahangayikishijwe no gutakaza imyigire mu rubyiruko.
mt0: <pad> Kandi, nk'uko byavuzwe haruguru, hafi kimwe cya gatatu cy'abayobozi, 37%, bibaza ko hari icyo biga mu bakiri bato.</s>

en: "Second only to mental health and trauma, and they're probably not totally independent concerns," Glick says.
kin: Glick agira ati: "Icya kabiri ku buzima bwo mu mutwe no guhahamuka, kandi birashoboka ko atari byo byigenga rwose."
mt0: <pad> "Inyuma gusa y'ubuzima bw'umubiri n'ibikomere, kandi ntabwo byagombye kuba ibibazo bitandukanye," Glick avuga.</s>

en: "It is part of that shift of mayors concerns from immediate threats to businesses closing and people getting sick, to some of these longer-term consequences that are going to persist in the future.
kin: "Ni bimwe mu byo guhindura abayobozi b'abayobozi biturutse ku iterabwoba ryihuse ku bucuruzi no gufunga abantu, kuri zimwe mu ngaruka z'igihe kirekire zizakomeza kubaho mu gihe kiri imbere.
mt0: <pad> "Ni igice cy'iyo nkuru ya Meya ihinduye ibitekerezo bye kuva ku bibazo bya hafi byo gufunga amasoko no kwandura indwara, ku bihe bya kure bitazaza mu gihe kiri imbere.</s>

en: And learning loss among their students, theyre worried it's going to persist for many, many, many years into the future. It's hard to make up for."
kin: Kandi gutakaza imyigire mu banyeshuri babo, bafite impungenge ko bigiye. komeza kuri benshi, benshi, imyaka myinshi mugihe kizaza. Biragoye kubihimbira. "
mt0: <pad> Kandi n'ibibazo byo gutakaza ubumenyi mu banyabigisha babo, bakaba bibaza ko bizakomeza kubaho mu gihe kirekire cyane mu gihe kiri imbere. Biragoye gusubiza.</s>

en: According to the survey, other top concerns for Americas mayors include the financial insecurity of low-income residents (33%), the closing of small businesses (29%) and increased crime and violence (26%).
kin: Nk’uko ubushakashatsi bwabigaragaje, izindi mpungenge z’abayobozi b’Amerika zirimo umutekano muke w’amafaranga ku baturage bafite amikoro make (33%), guhagarika imishinga mito (29%) no kongera ibyaha n’ihohoterwa (26%).
mt0: <pad> Bye bye corruption.</s>

en: Just 7% of mayors are worried about the shift to remote work and the long-term impact that could have on outmigration — people moving away from their cities.
kin: 7% by'abayobozi gusa bafite impungenge zo kwimukira mu kazi ka kure n'ingaruka z'igihe kirekire zishobora kugira ku kwimuka - abantu bava mu migi yabo.
mt0: <pad> 7% gusa nibo bibaza ko guhindura akazi ku ngendo n'ingaruka y'igihe kirekire ishobora kubaho ku muhanda — abantu bagenda bava mu mijyi yabo.</s>

en: The $350 billion in funding from the American Rescue Plan to local and state governments could help mayors address some of their concerns.
kin: Inkunga ingana na miliyari 350 z'amadorali yatanzwe na gahunda yo gutabara y'Abanyamerika kuri guverinoma z'ibanze na leta zishobora gufasha abayobozi gukemura ibibazo byabo.
mt0: <pad> The $350 billion in funding from the American Rescue Plan to local and state governments could help mayors address some of their concerns.</s>

en: The survey found that 78% of mayors believe the money will allow them to make meaningful change.
kin: Ubushakashatsi bwerekanye ko 78% by'abayobozi bemeza ko amafaranga azabafasha guhindura ibintu bifatika.
mt0: <pad> Nyuma y'ibibazo byagaragaye ko 78% by'abayobozi b'uturere bibaza ko amafaranga azabafasha gukora impinduka zikomeye.</s>

en: "What we're seeing is a large majority are using it for things they consider to be transformative and will make major changes to their cities," Glick says, "instead of feeling obligated or feeling the necessity to use it to plug up over-budget gaps to keep the doors open and the lights on."
kin: Glick agira ati: "Ibyo tubona ni benshi babikoresha mu bintu babona ko bihinduka kandi bizahindura imijyi yabo, aho kumva ko ari itegeko cyangwa kumva ko ari ngombwa kubikoresha kugira ngo uzibe icyuho cyingengo yimari kugirango imiryango ikingure kandi itara. "
mt0: <pad> "Ibintu byinshi turi kubona ni uko umubare munini w'abantu bamwe na bamwe bakoresha ibintu bihindura imibereho myiza y'ibisagara byabo, aho gukoresha ibintu bitagira ingaruka cyangwa kugirango bitume imiryango ifunguye kandi umuriro ukine," Glick aravuga, "aho gukoresha ibintu bitagira ingaruka cyangwa kugirango bitume imiryango ifunguye kandi umuriro ukine."</s>

en: Renting an apartment can be a challenge for new college graduates who are facing the hottest U.S. rental market in a decade, along with some unexpected competition from millennials — people aged 24 to 40 — and even baby boomers — the over-57 club.
kin: Gukodesha inzu birashobora kuba ingorabahizi kubanyeshuri barangije kaminuza bashya bahura nisoko rishyuha cyane muri Amerika mumyaka icumi, hamwe namarushanwa atunguranye kuva mumyaka igihumbi - abantu bafite imyaka 24 kugeza 40 - ndetse nabana bavuka - club irenga 57.
mt0: <pad> Renting an apartment can be a challenge for new college graduates who are facing the hottest U.S. rental market in a decade, along with some unexpected competition from millennials — people aged 24 to 40 — and even baby boomers — the over-57 club.</s>

en: "You have aging millennials who are creating families who should be moving from rental situations into ownership but, because of the lack of housing supply, that has been stopped in a lot of instances.
kin: "Ufite imyaka igihumbi ishaje irimo gushinga imiryango igomba kuva mu bukode ikajya mu nyungu, ariko, kubera kubura amazu, ibyo bikaba byarahagaritswe ahantu henshi.
mt0: <pad> "Ufite urubyiruko rw'abakuze bagenda buba abasha gukora umuryango w'abantu bagera ku myaka mirongo ine bari gushaka imiryango ariko, bitewe no kubura imitungo yo kubamo, byabaye bibujijwe mu buryo bwinshi.</s>

en: And so, what you see is the aging millennial population continues to rent," says Doug Ressler, manager of business intelligence at Yardi-Matrix, a commercial real estate data and research firm.
kin: Kandi rero, icyo ubona ni uko imyaka igihumbi ishaje ikomeje gukodesha, "ibi bikaba byavuzwe na Doug Ressler, umuyobozi ushinzwe amakuru y’ubucuruzi muri Yardi-Matrix, amakuru y’ubucuruzi n’ikigo cy’ubushakashatsi.
mt0: <pad> N'aho ubona, abantu bakuze b'aba miliyoni bavuga ko bagiye gukodesha amazu."</s>

en: "It's not just about millennials, it's not just about [Gen] Z [people under 24], we also see that boomers are making a transition, he added. "Their percentage of moving into rental properties is growing in the last five years."
kin: Yongeyeho ati: "Ntabwo ari nko mu myaka igihumbi gusa, ntabwo bireba gusa [Gen] Z [abantu bari munsi y’imyaka 24], turabona kandi ko abaterankunga barimo gukora inzibacyuho."
mt0: <pad> "Ibintu ntibyabaye ku millennials, it's not just about [Gen] Z [people under 24], we also see that boomers are making a transition," he added. "Iri rwego ry'uko bagenda mu bikoresho by'ubukode bw'inzu y'ububiko ryaguriye mu myaka itanu iheze."</s>

en: There are a variety of reasons older people are opting for rentals, according to Ressler.
kin: Hariho impamvu zitandukanye abantu bakuze bahitamo gukodesha nkuko Ressler abitangaza.
mt0: <pad> Hari impamvu nyinshi abantu bakuze bahitamo gukodesha, Ressler avuga.</s>

en: "They've lived in a home for so long and they want to be able to reduce their expenses on a fixed income," he says.
kin: Agira ati: "Babaye mu rugo igihe kirekire kandi barashaka kugabanya amafaranga bakoresheje ku musaruro uteganijwe."
mt0: <pad> "Bamaze kuba mu nzu imyaka myinshi kandi bakaba bashaka kugabanya ibiciro byabo ku mafaranga y'ingurane," yagize ati.</s>

en: "They want to live in a social cohort, like a retirement community, and things like that where it's much more socially amenable to them."
kin: "Bashaka gutura mu mibereho, nk'umuryango w'izabukuru, n'ibindi nk'ibyo aho biborohera cyane kuri bo."
mt0: <pad> "Bashaka kuba mu nzego z'umubano, nka umuryango w'abakuze, n'ibindi byo muri ubwo buryo aho biba bifite umutekano wo guhana ibitekerezo kurusha ahandi."</s>

en: The asking price of apartment rentals was up 10.7% in September 2021 compared to last year at the same time, according to the National Association of Realtors (NAR).
kin: Nk’uko Ishyirahamwe ry’Abacuruzi (NAR) ribitangaza ngo muri Nzeri 2021, igiciro cy’ubukode bw’amazu cyazamutseho 10.7% muri Nzeri 2021 ugereranije n’umwaka ushize.
mt0: <pad> Kwishyura ahantu hakodeshwa amazu byiyongereye 10.7% muri Nyakanga 2021 kurusha umwaka ushize, nk'uko bitangazwa n'Ikigo cy'Abacuruzi (NAR).</s>

en: "It's a hot market. We have never seen this market so hot in the last decade," says Gay Cororaton, NARs senior economist and director of housing and commercial research. "The average rent growth, year-over-year, is about 3-to-5%. We're seeing 11% rent growth now, so, clearly, way above trends weve had in the past."
kin: Gay Cororaton, impuguke mu by'ubukungu akaba n'umuyobozi ushinzwe imiturire n'ubushakashatsi mu bucuruzi, agira ati: "Ni isoko rishyushye. Ntabwo twigeze tubona iri soko rishyushye cyane mu myaka icumi ishize."
mt0: <pad> "Ni soko y'ubucuruzi ishushye. Ntabwo twageze tubona ubucuruzi bushushye nk'uko twabibonye mu myaka 10 iheze," says Gay Cororaton, NARs senior economist and director of housing and commercial research. "Umusaruro w'amahoro wa buri mwaka ni hagati ya 3-5 %. Ubu turi kugerageza gukora 11%, rero bigaragara ko byinshi birenze imbere y'ibihe twagize mu gihe cyashize."</s>

en: Renters are feeling the squeeze because the COVID-19 pandemic caused supply chain issues, slowing down home building in the United States.
kin: Abakodesha bumva bahungabanye kuko icyorezo cya COVID-19 cyateje ibibazo byo gutanga amasoko, bidindiza inyubako zamazu muri Amerika.
mt0: <pad> Renters are feeling the squeeze because the COVID-19 pandemic caused supply chain issues, slowing down home building in the United States.</s>

en: Instead of the usual 5-to-6 month supply of available single-family homes, supply dropped below two months in January 2021.
kin: Aho kugirango amezi 5 kugeza 6 asanzwe atange amazu yumuryango umwe, itangwa ryagabanutse munsi yamezi abiri muri Mutarama 2021.
mt0: <pad> Instead of the usual 5-to-6 month supply of available single-family homes, supply dropped below two months in January 2021.</s>

en: The lack of housing supply means millennials are having a harder time buying a single-family home, which has been the traditional trajectory in the past.
kin: Kubura amazu yo guturamo bivuze ko imyaka igihumbi igira ikibazo cyo kugura inzu yumuryango umwe, wahoze ari inzira gakondo mugihe cyashize.
mt0: <pad> Nta nzu ihari bituma urubyiruko rwari rufite ubushobozi bwo kugura inzu y'umuryango umwe, ari yo nzira isanzwe mu gihe cyashize.</s>

en: "The whole building industry was beset by supply chain issues," Cororaton says.
kin: Cororaton agira ati: "Inganda zose zubaka zari zugarijwe n'ibibazo bitangwa."
mt0: <pad> "Ubucuruzi bwose bwo gukora inzu bwari bufite ibibazo by'imikorere y'inganda," Cororaton avuga.</s>

en: "Shipments couldn't come in, the price of lumber was rising, manufacturing slowed, workers could not come in [to work], so you have shortages of frames, appliances. So, essentially, just a short supply."
kin: "Kohereza ntibishobora kwinjira, igiciro cy'ibiti cyariyongereye, inganda zidindiza, abakozi ntibashobora kwinjira [ku kazi], bityo ukaba ufite ikibazo cyo kubura amakadiri, ibikoresho. Rero, cyane cyane, ni bike."

en: The housing supply got even tighter during the pandemic as more investors put their money into housing, according to Cororaton, while existing homeowners looked for second homes.
kin: Itangwa ry'amazu ryarushijeho kwiyongera mu gihe cy'icyorezo kuko abashoramari benshi bashyira amafaranga yabo mu mazu nk'uko Cororaton abitangaza, mu gihe ba nyir'amazu bariho bashakisha amazu ya kabiri.

en: "With the pandemic, there was also a big demand for second homes, for vacation homes. Typically, vacation homes accounted for just about 5% [of the market]," she says.
kin: Agira ati: "Hamwe n'icyo cyorezo, hakenewe kandi amazu ya kabiri, amazu yo kuruhukiramo. Ubusanzwe, amazu y'ibiruhuko yari hafi 5% [ku isoko]".
mt0: <pad> "Mu gihe cy'icyorezo, hari kandi n'ibyo gutembera mu ngo bya kabiri, mu ngo zo gusohokamo. Ubusanzwe, inzu zo gusohokamo zafataga 5% [y'ubucuruzi]," avuga.</s>

en: "Early this summer they rose to about 8%. So again, strong demand and strong imbalance of demand and supply caused home prices to rise, made them less affordable."

mt0: <pad> "Mu ntangiriro z'uyu mwaka zazamutse ku kigero cya 8%. Rero, ubushake bukomeye n'itandukana rikomeye ry'ubushake n'isoko byatumye amazu agera hejuru, atari yo ushoboye kwishyura."</s>

en: The hottest rental markets right now are in the West and South. More renters are moving to Dallas and Houston in Texas, followed by Atlanta, Georgia; New York; Los Angeles; Austin, Texas; Phoenix, Arizona; and Washington, D.C., according to NAR.
kin: Amasoko akodeshwa ashyushye kurubu ni muburengerazuba no mumajyepfo. Abapangayi benshi bimukira i Dallas na Houston muri Texas, bakurikirwa na Atlanta, Jeworujiya; New York; Los Angeles; Austin, Texas; Phoenix, Arizona; na Washington, D.C., nk'uko NAR ibivuga.

en: Cororaton expects the coming year to be a little better but says the housing shortage is likely to continue for the next few years.

en: "You know, the old adage of moving from rentals into homeownership, that whole polemic may be changing," says Ressler.

en: "The sweet spot was always the millennials, and now the millennials are being replaced by the [Gen] Zs, but the millennials are staying longer and the Zs are coming on board, and now you've got the demographic of the boomers … What it means is a very profitable and dynamic [rental] market that's going to continue to grow."
